page.title: 09The Population of Cattistock
page.content: The population of the area consists of about 540, of whom roughly 12% are retired, with the same percentage aged under 17 years. There are insufficient children of primary school age to warrant a school in the village, so those children travel by coach to a nearby village. There is a playgroup for under 5 year-olds in the same village. The children of 11 years and over attend a comprehensive school about 11 miles distant; they also travel by coach. There are some agricultural workers in the village still, but quite a few inhabitants commute to the local towns for their various occupations. There is very little dialect spoken nowadays, except a word here and there from those few born in the area, now probably less than a quarter of the population.
